column4: REFILE-'Frack now  pay later ' top services companies say amid oil crash
column5: HOUSTON  Aug 7 Business is so tough for oilfield giants Schlumberger NV and Halliburton Co that they have come up with a new sales pitch for crude producers halting work in the worst downturn in years. It amounts to this: "frack now and pay later."

column4: Sun Life eyes bigger stake in India insurance venture
column5: TORONTO Canadian insurer Sun Life Financial Inc is interested in raising its stake in its Birla Sun Life Insurance joint venture in India as it weighs several acquisition opportunities in Asia and North America  its top executive said on Thursday.

column4: Tata Motors cuts sales  production targets for JLR in China
column5: MUMBAI/NEW DELHI Tata Motors Ltd  has cut prices  sales and production targets at its luxury Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) arm in China  a top executive said  as it struggles with high inventories in a slowing market.

column4: UPDATE 2-Tata Motors cuts sales  production targets for JLR in China
column5: * Strong JLR sales  mainly in China  has long helped Tata   (Adds CFO comments  details on China car market)

column4: India's Tata Motors Q1 profit nearly halves on weak China sales
column5: NEW DELHI  Aug 7 Quarterly profit at Tata Motors Ltd  India's top automaker by revenue  fell for the fourth consecutive quarter  as sales of its sleek Jaguar saloons and sporty Range Rovers dipped in China  the world's biggest car market.

column5: * H1 investments up 25.7 percent; CEO says TV partnerships boosting demand for broadband connections  Further company coverage:    (Reporting by Milan newsroom)

column4: Telecom Italia H1 profits hit by regulatory risk provisions
column5: MILAN  Aug 7 Core earnings at Telecom Italia  fell 16.4 percent in the first half  as 399 million euros ($436 million) in one-off charges to cover for regulatory and legal risks added to lower revenues in key markets Italy and Brazil.

column4: Orange raises prices in Spain after buying Jazztel
column5: MADRID  Aug 7 French telecom group Orange  said on Friday its Spanish unit would raise the price of mobile and fixed-line bundles from next month  following similar moves by competitors Telefonica and Vodafone .

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 3-Hutchison  Vimpelcom to merge Italian mobile businesses
column5: MILAN/PARIS  Aug 6 Vimpelcom and Hutchison have agreed to combine their Italian mobile operations in a long-awaited deal that would cut the number of players in Europe's fourth-largest telecom market to three from four.

column4: UPDATE 2-Canada's Telus adds wireless customers; revenue up 5.1 pct
column5: TORONTO  Aug 7 Telus Corp  one of Canada's three big telecoms providers  reported a 5.1 percent rise in quarterly revenue on Friday  while gaining wireless  Internet and television customers during a tumultuous period for the industry.

column4: Canadian telecom company Telus' profit falls 10.5 pct
column5: Aug 7 Canadian telecommunications company Telus Corp posted a 10.5 percent fall in quarterly profit  mainly due to an increase in costs and charges related to adjustments from higher corporate tax rates in Alberta.

column4: UPDATE 3-Berkshire profit falls 37 pct on investment  insurance slump
column5: Aug 7 Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc   said on Friday its second-quarter profit fell 37 percent  reflecting a significant decline in investment gains and an underwriting loss from insurance operations  which include Geico.
